subtitle: Don’t get bitten by mosquitoes
title: How can I protect myself from Zika?
content:
Created by BabyCenter


There are 2 ways to help avoid Zika: 

1.	Don’t get bitten

2.  Stop mosquitoes breeding

The mosquito that carries Zika usually bites in the day.  

If you live in, or are travelling to countries where outbreaks of Zika have been reported, take these steps  to avoid getting bitten:

•	Wear clothes that cover your skin. Mosquitoes are attracted to dark colors. Wear light-colored clothes.

•	Use insect repellents on your skin. Ask at the pharmacy which ones to use. Or look for one that contains DEET, picaridin, or IR3535. 

•	Use a net. Sleep and rest under an insecticide-treated mosquito net. Use it in the day and at night, even in hot weather. 

•	Tuck the net around you. If it has holes, patch them with fabric. 

•	Dump standing water in your vicinity and seal trash in plastic bags. Mosquitoes are found near water and trash. 

•	Keep mosquitoes out of the building. Use screens and nets in windows and doors. Keep windows and doors closed.

•	Stay in air conditioned places, to avoid any chance of contact with a Zika-carrying mosquito

In some places, agencies may spray to kill mosquitoes.  

If you are pregnant and think you may have Zika go to your healthcare provider.




[7 ways to protect yourself from mosquitoes][1] 

Photo Credit: © CDC/Division of Vector-borne Diseases


  [1]: http://www.babycenter.com/101_7-ways-to-protect-yourself-from-mosquitoes_10412666.bc
